experience.title: Actuarial Research Assistant
responsibilities: Conducted longitudinal research on mortality improvement scales using Lee-Carter modeling in R to forecast future life expectancy trends.
Performed multivariate regression analysis on a dataset of 500,000+ records to identify key variables impacting health insurance claim frequency.
Developed a stochastic simulation model to test the impact of varying interest rate environments on long-term annuity liabilities.
Collaborated with faculty to refine data cleansing protocols for raw insurance industry datasets, ensuring 99% accuracy in downstream modeling.

experience.title: Predictive Risk Modeling Researcher
responsibilities: Analyzed the correlation between macroeconomic indicators and life insurance lapse rates using Generalized Linear Models (GLMs).
Utilized SQL to query large-scale historical market data for use in Monte Carlo simulations of pension fund solvency.
Prepared technical documentation and data visualizations explaining tail-risk scenarios and Value at Risk (VaR) for faculty review.

metadata.experience_level: Relevant research done for the job field.
